pr_title: [JBPM-8910] How to use a "OR" query operator in a custom query in the query-parameters

timeline.message:
[JBPM-8910] How to use a "OR" query operator in a custom query in the query-parameters

supporting omision in cond-column when the expression is logical

timeline.bodyText: I think this condition always matches, so it shouldn't be needed, wdyt?
timeline.author: gmunozfe

replies.bodyText: I don't think so contains key only will be true if the object has that property. Do you mind to test what you are thinking ?
replies.author: elguardian

replies.bodyText: Right, forget my comment, I was only thinking in json with queryparams
replies.author: gmunozfe

replies.bodyText: BTW, the code-smell that SonarCloud complains, is related to convert "cond-operator" (4 times) into a constant. It may be also applied to "cond-column" and "cond-values", but it's up to you as nice-to-have.
replies.author: gmunozfe
